DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name assigned to a surgical procedure done for diagnostic, surveillance, treatment, palliation, or study-directed purposes.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used._The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The name of the diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of a cancer as well as some of the breast tissue around the tumor and the lining over the chest muscles below the tumor. Usually some of the lymph nodes under the arm are also taken out.  Also called segmental mastectomy.: A surgical procedure in which an entire lesion is removed for microscopic examination.: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a discrete mass.
A surgical procedure in which an entire lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (lo-BEK-toe-mee) The removal of a lobe.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of a lobe of an organ.

PermissibleValues.value: Gross total resection with neck dissection

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Visible to the naked eye.: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ. : (dye-SEK-shun) Surgery to remove lymph nodes and other tissues in the neck.

Concepts.definition: Visible to the naked eye.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
Surgery to remove lymph nodes and other tissues in the neck.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal of fluid or a sample of fluid and cells through a needle. (from medicinenet.com)

Concepts.definition: Procedure using suction, usually with a thin needle and syringe, to remove bodily fluid or tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.7.26 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002656. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (KRYE-o-SIR-jer-ee) Treatment performed with an instrument that freezes and destroys abnormal tissues.

Concepts.definition: The use of extreme cold to damage or destroy a body part, pathway, or function. The procedure is performed using small cryogenic probes during surgery, and has recently been applied to solitary sporadic renal tumor lesions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (pros-ta-TEK-toe-mee) An operation to remove part or all of the prostate. Radical (or total) prostatectomy is the removal of the entire prostate and some of the tissue around it.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the prostate.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal of the breast, pectoral muscles, axillary lymph nodes, and associated skin and subcutaneous tissue (from MeSH).

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of one or both breasts, including the areola, nipple, axillary lymph nodes, and pectoral muscles.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not characterized in any other way.

Concepts.definition: Not characterized in any other way.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery for breast cancer in which the breast, most or all of the lymph nodes under the arm, and the lining over the chest muscles are removed. Sometimes the surgeon also removes part of the chest wall muscles.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of one or both breasts, including the areola, nipple, and the majority of the axillary lymph nodes, but sparing the pectoralis major muscle.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood vessel that carries blood toward the heart.: Removal or excision by surgical measures.

Concepts.definition: A blood vessel that carries blood toward the heart.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (ek-SPLOR-uh-TOR-ee SER-juh-ree) Surgery to look inside the body to help make a diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: Surgery to look inside the body to help make a diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The simultaneous surgical resection of the urinary bladder and prostate gland with pelvic lymphadenectomy.

Concepts.definition: The simultaneous surgical resection of the urinary bladder and prostate gland with pelvic lymphadenectomy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Resection of a segment of an organ or partial resection of a gland.

Concepts.definition: Resection of a segment of an organ or partial resection of a gland.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The use of a thin, lighted tube (called an endoscope) to examine the inside of the chest.

Concepts.definition: Endoscopic examination of the thoracic cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical opening of the mediastinum.

Concepts.definition: Surgical opening of the mediastinum.

PermissibleValues.value: Modified radical mastectomy after partial mastectomy as first attempt
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Modified Radical Mastectomy after Partial Mastectomy as first attempt

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Modified Radical Mastectomy after Partial Mastectomy as first attempt
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery for breast cancer in which the breast, most or all of the lymph nodes under the arm, and the lining over the chest muscles are removed. Sometimes the surgeon also removes part of the chest wall muscles.: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.: Partial; being or affecting only a part; not total: Surgical removal of the breast.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of one or both breasts, including the areola, nipple, and the majority of the axillary lymph nodes, but sparing the pectoralis major muscle.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
Being or affecting only a part of something.
Surgical removal of the breast.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/19/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal of the body and tail of the pancreas.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the distal part of the pancreas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.: Surgical removal of the pancreas. (Dorland, 28th ed)

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
Surgical removal of part or all of the pancreas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of part of the pancreas, duodenum, and distal part of the bile duct.  Sometimes, the lower portion of the stomach and the gallbladder are also removed.  This procedure is performed for pancreatic, ampullary, duodenal and distal bile duct cancers.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part of the pancreas, duodenum, and distal part of the bile duct.  Sometimes, the lower portion of the stomach and the gallbladder are also removed.  This procedure is performed for pancreatic, ampullary, duodenal and distal bile duct cancers.

PermissibleValues.value: Gross total resection without neck dissection
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Gross Total Resection Without Neck Dissection

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Gross Total Resection Without Neck Dissection
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Visible to the naked eye.: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ. : Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone. (from Merriam-Webster OnLine): (dye-SEK-shun) Surgery to remove lymph nodes and other tissues in the neck.

Concepts.definition: Visible to the naked eye.
Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
Surgery to remove lymph nodes and other tissues in the neck.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove lymph nodes and other tissues in the neck.

Concepts.definition: Surgery to remove lymph nodes and other tissues in the neck.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the region of the breast (approximately one quarter) containing cancer.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of one quarter of the tissue in a breast tissue, including ipsilateral chest wall muscles within a given margin of the tumor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal of the breast tissue, nipple, areola, and original biopsy scar, but not the breast skin.: Mastectomy with preservation of the breast skin and the skin of the nipple and areola.

Concepts.definition: Removal of the breast tissue, nipple, areola, and original biopsy scar, but not the breast skin.
Mastectomy with preservation of the breast skin and the skin of the nipple and areola.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal of only the breast tissue and nipple and a small portion of the overlying skin.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure involving the removal of the entire breast tissue, nipple and a portion of the overlying skin, while leaving the axillary contents intact.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The surgical removal of a discrete mass.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a discrete mass.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to synch with current NCIt. mc 8.17.20

PermissibleValues.value: Oncoplastic Partial Mastectomy/Lumpectomy with Oncoplastic Closure
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Oncoplastic Partial Mastectomy/Lumpectomy with Oncoplastic Closure

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Oncoplastic Partial Mastectomy/Lumpectomy with Oncoplastic Closure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which there is full-thickness excision of the malignant breast tumor and surrounding breast parenchyma to allow resection with wide surgical margins, while the remaining fibroglandular breast tissue is transposed to preserve the breast shape and cosmetic appearance in the best possible way.

Concepts.longName: Oncoplastic Partial Mastectomy/Lumpectomy with Oncoplastic Closure
Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which there is full-thickness excision of the malignant breast tumor and surrounding breast parenchyma to allow resection with wide surgical margins, while the remaining fibroglandular breast tissue is transposed to preserve the breast shape and cosmetic appearance in the best possible way.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure that removes the breast tissue while leaving the skin, nipple, areola, and chest wall muscles intact.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure that removes the breast tissue while leaving the skin, nipple, areola, and chest wall muscles intact.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of a cancer as well as some of the breast tissue around the tumor and the lining over the chest muscles below the tumor. Usually some of the lymph nodes under the arm are also taken out.  Also called segmental mastectomy.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a discrete mass.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of a cancer as well as some of the breast tissue around the tumor and the lining over the chest muscles below the tumor. Usually some of the lymph nodes under the arm are also taken out.  Also called segmental mastectomy.: Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone. (from Merriam-Webster OnLine): A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a discrete mass.
Used to indicate the absence or lack of something or someone.
A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of a triangular wedge shaped section of tissue.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of a triangular wedge shaped section of tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The surgical removal of as much of a malignant tumor as is reasonably possible. This procedure increases the effectiveness of the subsequent administration of chemotherapy and/or radiation therapy.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of as much of a malignant tumor as is reasonably possible. This procedure increases the effectiveness of the subsequent administration of chemotherapy and/or radiation therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Removal of internal organs and tissues, usually radical removal of the contents of a body cavity.

Concepts.definition: Removal of internal organs and tissues, usually radical removal of the contents of a body cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The surgical removal of superficial inguinal lymph nodes and deep femoral lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of superficial inguinal lymph nodes and deep femoral lymph nodes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of little substance or significance; involving only a surface.: Surgical excision of one or more lymph nodes. Its most common use is in cancer surgery. (From Dorland, 28th ed, p966)

Concepts.definition: Of little substance or significance; involving only a surface.
Surgical removal of lymph nodes, usually done to assess the spread of cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove an affected area of the vulva (the external female genital organs, including the clitoris, vaginal lips, and the opening to the vagina) along with a small amount of surrounding normal tissue.

Concepts.definition: Surgery to remove an affected area of the vulva (the external female genital organs, including the clitoris, vaginal lips, and the opening to the vagina) along with a small amount of surrounding normal tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove the entire vulva (the external female genital organs, including the clitoris, vaginal lips, and the opening to the vagina) and nearby lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: Surgery to remove the entire vulva (the external female genital organs, including the clitoris, vaginal lips, and the opening to the vagina) and nearby lymph nodes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the remaining abnormal tissues from the body, not completely removed in an earlier attempt.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of all of the uterus, via an abdominal approach.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of all of the uterus, via an abdominal approach.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove the uterus, cervix, and part of the vagina. The ovaries, fallopian tubes, and nearby lymph nodes may also be removed.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of the uterus and surrounding structures, including bilateral pelvic lymph nodes, the parametrium, and the upper one-third to one-half of the vagina.

PermissibleValues.value: Total Abdominal Hysterectomy with Bilateral Salpingo-Oophorectomy
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Total Abdominal Hysterectomy with Bilateral Salpingo-Oophorectomy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Total Abdominal Hysterectomy with Bilateral Salpingo-Oophorectomy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of all of the uterus, and the right and left fallopian tubes, and the right and left ovaries.

Concepts.longName: Total Abdominal Hysterectomy with Bilateral Salpingo-Oophorectomy
Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of all of the uterus, and the right and left fallopian tubes, and the right and left ovaries.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of part or all of the esophagus.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the esophagus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of part or all of the colon.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the colon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation to remove all or part of the colon through a long incision made in the wall of the abdomen. When only part of the colon is removed, it is called a partial colectomy.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part of the colon.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An X-ray procedure using multiple coordinates to precisely determine the location of a tumor or nodule so as to obtain a tissue sample.

Concepts.definition: A biopsy procedure that uses 3-dimensional imaging to localize a lesion and guide the removal of a tissue sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the pancreas. (Dorland, 28th ed)

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the pancreas.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery performed after primary treatment to determine whether tumor cells remain.: (lap-a-RAH-toe-mee) A surgical incision made in the wall of the abdomen.

Concepts.definition: Surgery performed after cancer treatment to assess the results of prior treatment and to plan possible future treatment.
Creation of a surgical opening into the abdominal cavity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body and cervix, via the vaginal approach.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body and cervix, via the vaginal approach.

PermissibleValues.value: Fine Needle Aspiration under CT Guidance

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.: A device designed to help direct the passage of another object.: The removal of tissue or fluid with a thin needle for examination under a microscope.

Concepts.definition: A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.
A device designed to help direct the passage of another object.
The removal of tissue or fluid with a thin needle for examination under a microscope.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The use of ultrasound imaging to guide needle aspiration through the bronchial wall.

Concepts.definition: The use of ultrasound imaging to guide needle aspiration through the bronchial wall.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical opening of the anterior mediastinum.

Concepts.definition: Surgical opening of the anterior mediastinum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (noo-mo-NEK-toe-mee) An operation to remove an entire lung.

Concepts.definition: The excision of part or all of a lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic surgical procedure involving the removal of two lobes of the right lung.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic surgical procedure involving the removal of two lobes of the right lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: (MEE-dee-a-stin-AHS-ko-pee) A procedure in which a tube is inserted into the chest to view the organs in the area between the lungs and nearby lymph nodes. The tube is inserted through an incision above the breastbone. This procedure is usually performed to get a tissue sample from the lymph nodes on the right side of the chest.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure during which a mediastinoscope is inserted into the thorax to view the its contents for diagnostic and/or therapeutic purposes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal and examination of the sentinel node, the lymph node which is first in receiving the lymphatic drainage of a specified anatomic location and is most likely to be affected by the lymphatic spread of cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical excision of one or more lymph nodes. Its most common use is in cancer surgery. (From Dorland, 28th ed, p966)

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of lymph nodes, usually done to assess the spread of cancer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Creation of a surgical opening into the abdominal cavity.

Concepts.definition: Creation of a surgical opening into the abdominal cavity.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated definition to match current NCIt. mc 4.23.19

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove all of the bladder (the organ that holds urine) as well as nearby tissues and organs.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of the entire bladder, a portion of the urethra, adjacent lymph nodes, and additional genitourinary structures, including the prostate and a portion of the vas deferens in men, and the ovaries, fallopian tubes, uterus, and a portion of the vagina in women.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery performed with a special instrument inserted through the urethra.

Concepts.definition: Surgery performed with a special instrument inserted through the urethra.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to, involving, or affecting the thorax and abdomen.: Surgical removal of part or all of the esophagus.

Concepts.definition: Relating to, involving, or affecting the thorax and abdomen.
Surgical removal of part or all of the esophagus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery involving partial excision of the thyroid gland.

Concepts.definition: Surgery involving partial excision of the thyroid gland.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remover part or all of the thyroid gland.

Concepts.definition: Surgery to remover part or all of the thyroid gland.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove the ovary and fallopian tube on one side of the body.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of either the left or right ovary and its corresponding fallopian tube.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body and cervix. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body and cervix. -- 2004

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Directed to the root or source of a morbid process; to remove the root of a disease or all diseased tissue, as radical surgery.: Surgery to remove the cervix (the end of the uterus that forms a canal between the uterus and the vagina).The upper part of the vagina and certain pelvic lymph nodes may also be removed.

Concepts.definition: Directed to the root or source of a morbid process; to remove the root of a disease or all diseased tissue, as radical surgery.
The surgical removal of the uterine cervix.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or pertaining to the peritoneum.: Sampling; the selection or making of a sample.

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to the peritoneum.

The selection and obtaining of small representative quantities of biological material for the purpose of analysis; also, in biomedical statistics, sampling is the selection and implementation of statistical observations in order to estimate properties of an underlying population; also, in environmental science, the collection of representative specimens analyzed to characterize site conditions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure to remove the uterine body. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part of the uterus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lymph node located adjacent to the lumbar region of the spine.: The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.

Concepts.definition: A lymph node located adjacent to the lumbar region of the spine.
The process of cutting apart or separating tissue as, for example, in the study of anatomy or in the course of a surgical procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Partial or complete resection of the omentum.

Concepts.definition: Partial or complete resection of the omentum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.: Surgical removal of as much of a tumor as possible. Debulking may increase the chance that chemotherapy or radiation therapy will kill all the tumor cells. It may also be done to relieve symptoms or help the patient live longer.

Concepts.definition: The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.

Surgical removal of as much of a tumor as possible. Debulking may increase the chance that chemotherapy or radiation therapy will kill all the tumor cells. It may also be done to relieve symptoms or help the patient live longer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of a cone-shaped portion of tissue from the uterine cervix.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of a cone-shaped portion of tissue from the uterine cervix.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the right and left fallopian tubes, and the right and left ovaries.

Concepts.definition: Surgery to remove both fallopian tubes, as well as both ovaries.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The total system of structures outside the lungs that move as a part of breathing; it includes all structures from the skin to the parietal pleura.: The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: The total system of structures outside the lungs that move as a part of breathing; it includes all structures from the skin to the parietal pleura.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.: Resection of a segment of an organ or partial resection of a gland.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.
Resection of a segment of an organ or partial resection of a gland.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Excision of a lung and part of the pericardium.

Concepts.definition: Excision of a lung and part of the pericardium.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/19/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Resection of a segment of an organ or partial resection of a gland.: Pertaining to a portion of a lobe.

Concepts.definition: Resection of a segment of an organ or partial resection of a gland.
Pertaining to a portion of a lobe.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/19/2015.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove a lung tumor in a lobe of the lung and a part of the main bronchus (airway). The ends of the bronchus are rejoined and any remaining lobes are reattached to the bronchus. This surgery is done to save part of the lung.

Concepts.definition: Surgery to remove a lung tumor in a lobe of the lung and a part of the main bronchus (airway). The ends of the bronchus are rejoined and any remaining lobes are reattached to the bronchus. This surgery is done to save part of the lung.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation to remove the spleen.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the spleen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of the vermiform appendix.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of the vermiform appendix.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A muscular tube that extends from the end of the small intestine to the anus. (NCI): The act of cutting out; the surgical removal of part or all of a structure or organ.

Concepts.definition: A muscular tube that extends from the end of the small intestine to the anus.
The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of part or all of the small intestine.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of part or all of the small intestine.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure that refers to the removal of the diaphragmatic sites affected by cancer.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure that refers to the removal of the diaphragmatic sites affected by cancer.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 7/6/23 Added missing concept per cleanup activities cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure that refers to the removal of the peritoneal sites affected by cancer.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure that refers to the removal of the peritoneal sites affected by cancer.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 7/6/23 Added missing concept per cleanup activities cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or pertaining to the peritoneum.: (KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.: The act of putting one thing into another.

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to the peritoneum.
(KATH-i-ter) A flexible tube used to deliver fluids into or withdraw fluids from the body.
The act of putting one thing into another.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A medical inspection, qualified according to the methods employed, as physical examination, radiologic examination, diagnostic imaging examination, etc., performed under conditions of patient's complete or partial local or general insensibility to pain with or without the loss of consciousness, induced by an anesthetic agent or by non-pharmacological anesthesia technique.: Endoscopic examination of the esophagus.

Concepts.definition: A medical inspection, qualified according to the methods employed, as physical examination, radiologic examination, diagnostic imaging examination, etc., performed under conditions of patient's complete or partial local or general insensibility to pain with or without the loss of consciousness, induced by an anesthetic agent or by non-pharmacological anesthesia technique.
Endoscopic examination of the esophagus.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A medical inspection, qualified according to the methods employed, as physical examination, radiologic examination, diagnostic imaging examination, etc., performed under conditions of patient's complete or partial local or general insensibility to pain with or without the loss of consciousness, induced by an anesthetic agent or by non-pharmacological anesthesia technique.: Endoscopic examination of the tracheobronchial tree.

Concepts.definition: A medical inspection, qualified according to the methods employed, as physical examination, radiologic examination, diagnostic imaging examination, etc., performed under conditions of patient's complete or partial local or general insensibility to pain with or without the loss of consciousness, induced by an anesthetic agent or by non-pharmacological anesthesia technique.
Endoscopic examination of the tracheobronchial tree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A medical inspection, qualified according to the methods employed, as physical examination, radiologic examination, diagnostic imaging examination, etc., performed under conditions of patient's complete or partial local or general insensibility to pain with or without the loss of consciousness, induced by an anesthetic agent or by non-pharmacological anesthesia technique.: Endoscopic examination of the larynx.

Concepts.definition: A medical inspection, qualified according to the methods employed, as physical examination, radiologic examination, diagnostic imaging examination, etc., performed under conditions of patient's complete or partial local or general insensibility to pain with or without the loss of consciousness, induced by an anesthetic agent or by non-pharmacological anesthesia technique.
Endoscopic examination of the larynx.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Examination Under Anesthesia Nasal Endoscopic Procedure

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Examination Under Anesthesia Nasal Endoscopic Procedure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A medical inspection, qualified according to the methods employed, as physical examination, radiologic examination, diagnostic imaging examination, etc., performed under conditions of patient's complete or partial local or general insensibility to pain with or without the loss of consciousness, induced by an anesthetic agent or by non-pharmacological anesthesia technique.: In reference to the nose.: A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.

Concepts.definition: A medical inspection, qualified according to the methods employed, as physical examination, radiologic examination, diagnostic imaging examination, etc., performed under conditions of patient's complete or partial local or general insensibility to pain with or without the loss of consciousness, induced by an anesthetic agent or by non-pharmacological anesthesia technique.
In reference to the nose.
A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Creation of a surgical opening into the trachea.

Concepts.definition: Creation of a surgical opening into the trachea.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 7/6/23 Added missing concept for VM per cleanup activities cjl.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which all the ipsilateral cervical lymph node groups of the neck are removed but the internal jugular vein, sternocleidomastoid muscle, and/or spinal accessory nerve are preserved.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which all the ipsilateral cervical lymph node groups of the neck are removed but the internal jugular vein, sternocleidomastoid muscle, and/or spinal accessory nerve are preserved.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Neck dissection including the anatomical structures that define the neck lymph node boundary and sublevel including levels II through IV.
Neck dissection including the anatomical structures that define the neck lymph node boundary and sublevel including levels I through IV.

A minimally invasive procedure in which a surgeon performs surgical neck procedures through the mouth using a robotic surgical system.: Directed to the root or source of a morbid process; to remove the root of a disease or all diseased tissue, as radical surgery.: Surgical removal of the tonsils.

Concepts.definition: A minimally invasive procedure in which a surgeon performs surgical neck procedures through the mouth using a robotic surgical system.
Directed to the root or source of a morbid process; to remove the root of a disease or all diseased tissue, as radical surgery.
Surgical removal of the tonsils.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Transoral Robotic Surgery Deep Tonsil Biopsy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Transoral Robotic Surgery Deep Tonsil Biopsy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minimally invasive procedure in which a surgeon performs surgical neck procedures through the mouth using a robotic surgical system.: Extending relatively far inward.: The two organs situated in the throat on either side of the narrow passage from the mouth to the pharynx. They are composed of lymphoid tissues.: The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: A minimally invasive procedure in which a surgeon performs surgical neck procedures through the mouth using a robotic surgical system.
Extending relatively far inward.
The two organs situated in the throat on either side of the narrow passage from the mouth to the pharynx. They are composed of lymphoid tissues.
The removal of tissue specimens or fluid from the living body for microscopic examination, performed to establish a diagnosis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minimally invasive procedure in which a surgeon performs surgical neck procedures through the mouth using a robotic surgical system.: The lymphoid follicles on the dorsal surface in the posterior region of the tongue.: Surgical removal of the tonsils.

Concepts.definition: A minimally invasive procedure in which a surgeon performs surgical neck procedures through the mouth using a robotic surgical system.
The lymphoid follicles on the dorsal surface in the posterior region of the tongue.
Surgical removal of the tonsils.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minimally invasive procedure in which a surgeon performs surgical neck procedures through the mouth using a robotic surgical system.: Two masses of lymphatic tissue located one on either side of the oropharynx in the oropharyngeal isthmus.: Surgical removal of the tonsils.

Concepts.definition: A minimally invasive procedure in which a surgeon performs surgical neck procedures through the mouth using a robotic surgical system.
Two masses of lymphatic tissue located one on either side of the oropharynx in the oropharyngeal isthmus.
Surgical removal of the tonsils.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which an entire lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure in which an entire lesion is removed for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.

Concepts.definition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle with a relatively large diameter, for microscopic examination.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Devices that provide support for tubular structures that are being anastomosed or for body cavities during skin grafting.

Concepts.definition: Devices that provide support for tubular structures that are being anastomosed or for body cavities during skin grafting.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or pertaining to the pelvis.: Any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.: The selection and obtaining of small representative quantities of biological material for the purpose of analysis; also, in biomedical statistics, sampling is the selection and implementation of statistical observations in order to estimate properties of an underlying population; also, in environmental science, the collection of representative specimens analyzed to characterize site conditions.

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to the pelvis.
Any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part.

The selection and obtaining of small representative quantities of biological material for the purpose of analysis; also, in biomedical statistics, sampling is the selection and implementation of statistical observations in order to estimate properties of an underlying population; also, in environmental science, the collection of representative specimens analyzed to characterize site conditions.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of one or more pelvic lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of one or more pelvic lymph nodes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Relating to the stomach.: The act of moving air into and out of a space.: A hollow cylinder, especially one for holding or conveying liquids; anything shaped like such a hollow cylinder, e.g. an organic structure having the shape or function of a tube such as channel within a plant or animal body (e.g. fallopian tube).

Concepts.definition: Relating to the stomach.
The act of moving air into and out of a space.

A hollow cylinder, especially one for holding or conveying liquids; anything shaped like such a hollow cylinder, e.g. an organic structure having the shape or function of a tube such as channel within a plant or animal body (e.g. fallopian tube).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove one or more metastases (tumors formed from cells that have spread from the primary tumor). When all metastases are removed, it is called a complete metastasectomy.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of metastases.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Therapeutic blockage of an artery by a clot of foreign material.

Concepts.definition: Therapeutic blockage of an artery by a clot of foreign material.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgical removal of a kidney, the adrenal gland, adjacent lymph nodes, and other surrounding tissue.

Concepts.definition: Surgical removal of a kidney, the adrenal gland, adjacent lymph nodes, and other surrounding tissue.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove one kidney.

Concepts.definition: Surgery to remove one kidney.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The surgical removal of a portion of a kidney.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a portion of a kidney.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: PATIENT PREVIOSLY HAD A PARTIAL CYSTECTOMY

ValueMeaning.preferredName: PATIENT PREVIOSLY HAD A PARTIAL CYSTECTOMY
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery to remove part of the bladder (the organ that holds urine).

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a portion of the bladder.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure in which tissue is removed.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A urinary diversion after the removal of the urinary bladder that uses a loop of intestine that is surgically fashioned into a pouch and placed in the location of the original bladder and then attached to the ureters and urethra simulating the function of the original organ.

Concepts.definition: A urinary diversion after the removal of the urinary bladder that uses a loop of intestine that is surgically fashioned into a pouch and placed in the location of the original bladder and then attached to the ureters and urethra simulating the function of the original organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure used to treat bladder tumors, during which a resectoscope is passed through the urethra and into the bladder.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure used to treat bladder tumors, during which a resectoscope is passed through the urethra and into the bladder.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Continent urinary diversion procedure in which the surgically-created pouch requires a catheter to be inserted to drain the urine.

Concepts.definition: Continent urinary diversion procedure in which the surgically-created pouch requires a catheter to be inserted to drain the urine.

PermissibleValues.value: Sentinel Lymph Node Mapping And Pelvic Lymphadenectomy
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Sentinel Lymph Node Mapping And Pelvic Lymphadenectomy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Sentinel Lymph Node Mapping And Pelvic Lymphadenectomy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure that detects early metastases to the lymph nodes of the axilla. A radioactive tracer material is injected into the tissue prior to surgery and an X-ray picture is taken to visualize the lymph node system. The surgeon uses a small probe to find the lymph node and if the sentinel lymph node is free of cancer, the other lymph nodes in the axilla may not need to be removed. This minimizes the risks and side effects of a full lymph node dissection.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: Surgical removal of one or more pelvic lymph nodes.

Concepts.definition: A technique that uses dyes and/or radioactive agents to map the lymphatic drainage of an area in which a tumor is located, thereby identifying the sentinel node.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Surgical removal of one or more pelvic lymph nodes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Incision into or through the setrnum.  NCI Concept Code C25220.

Concepts.definition: Incision into or through the sternum.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The surgical removal of all or part of a limb or other appendage.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of all or part of a limb or other appendage.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure to remove a diseased area and to reconstruct the area resected.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove a diseased area and to reconstruct the area resected.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure to remove a diseased area without reconstruction of the area resected.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure to remove a diseased area without reconstruction of the area resected.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure used to treat malignant bone tumors near the knee in which the bottom of the femur and the upper tibia are surgically removed and the lower leg is rotated 180 degrees and re-attached to the femur. The foot and ankle then function as a substitute knee joint allowing for comparable stability to a below-the-knee amputation when placed in a prosthetic.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure used to treat malignant bone tumors near the knee in which the bottom of the femur and the upper tibia are surgically removed and the lower leg is rotated 180 degrees and re-attached to the femur. The foot and ankle then function as a substitute knee joint allowing for comparable stability to a below-the-knee amputation when placed in a prosthetic.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Outside of or excluding the lungs._The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor._The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ.

Concepts.definition: Outside of or excluding the lungs.

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.
The surgical removal of an organ or a part of an organ.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Surgery for rectal cancer involving precise removal of an intact mesorectal envelope with tumor-free margins.  Associated with local recurrence rates below 5% in clinical trials.  (from Medscape)

Concepts.definition: Surgery for rectal cancer involving precise removal of an intact mesorectal envelope with tumor-free margins.  Associated with local recurrence rates below 5% in clinical trials.  (from Medscape)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An endoscopic surgical procedure designed to give transanal access to resecting benign, premalignant, or early malignant lesions in the mid- to proximal rectum. Transanal endoscopic microsurgery (TEM) and transanal endoscopic operation (TEO) are rigid platforms, whereas transanal minimally invasive surgery (TAMIS) is a flexible platform.

Concepts.definition: An endoscopic surgical procedure designed to give transanal access to resecting benign, premalignant, or early malignant lesions in the mid- to proximal rectum. Transanal endoscopic microsurgery (TEM) and transanal endoscopic operation (TEO) are rigid platforms, whereas transanal minimally invasive surgery (TAMIS) is a flexible platform.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Traditional surgery using a long incision for visualization and for the insertion of instruments.

Concepts.definition: Traditional surgery using a long incision for visualization and for the insertion of instruments.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A surgical procedure during which a laparoscope is inserted into the abdomen to view the abdominopelvic contents for diagnostic and/or therapeutic purposes._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A minimally invasive thoracic surgical procedure that makes use of a thoracoscope.

Concepts.definition: A surgical procedure during which a laparoscope is inserted into the abdomen to view the abdominopelvic contents for diagnostic and/or therapeutic purposes.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A minimally invasive thoracic surgical procedure that makes use of a thoracoscope.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or therapeutic procedure in which an endoscope is inserted in a tubular organ to examine the structural architecture and/or remove abnormal tissues.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A needle biopsy that is done through the skin.

Concepts.definition: A needle biopsy that is done through the skin.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:The words or language units by which a thing is known.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
The words or language units by which a thing is known.
